# Copilot Instructions for Matthew Anderson's Portfolio

## Project Overview
This is Matthew Anderson (@and3rn3t)'s personal portfolio website hosted on GitHub Pages. It's a modern, interactive showcase featuring real-time GitHub statistics, project highlights, and professional information.

## üéØ Project Type & Stack
- **Type**: Static Portfolio Website (GitHub Pages)
- **Frontend**: Vanilla HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript (ES6+)
- **Deployment**: GitHub Pages with automated workflows
- **APIs**: GitHub REST API for dynamic content
- **Styling**: Custom CSS with responsive design and dark/light themes

## üìÅ Key Files & Structure
- `index.html` - Main portfolio page with comprehensive sections
- `styles.css` - Custom styling with CSS variables and responsive design
- `script.js` - Interactive functionality and GitHub API integration
- `projects-data.json` - Structured project information and metadata
- `README.md` - Repository documentation and project showcase
- `.github/workflows/` - CI/CD automation for metrics and deployment

## üé® Design Principles & Standards

### Code Style
- Use semantic HTML5 elements
- Follow BEM methodology for CSS class naming where applicable
- Use modern JavaScript (ES6+) with const/let, arrow functions, async/await
- Maintain consistent indentation (2 spaces for HTML/CSS, 4 spaces for JS)
- Keep functions pure and modular where possible

### CSS Guidelines
- Use CSS custom properties (variables) for consistent theming
- Follow mobile-first responsive design approach
- Implement both light and dark theme support
- Use Flexbox and Grid for layouts
- Maintain consistent spacing using defined scale (8px base unit)
- Prioritize performance with efficient selectors

### JavaScript Guidelines
- Use modern async/await for API calls
- Implement proper error handling for GitHub API requests
- Follow functional programming principles where appropriate
- Use descriptive variable and function names
- Add loading states for dynamic content
- Implement graceful fallbacks for failed API requests

## üöÄ Core Features & Functionality

### GitHub Integration
- Real-time repository statistics and metrics
- Dynamic project loading from GitHub API
- Repository stars, forks, and language data
- Activity tracking and contribution graphs
- Automated metrics generation via GitHub Actions

### Interactive Elements
- Smooth scroll navigation with offset for fixed navbar
- Mobile-responsive hamburger menu
- Theme toggle (dark/light mode)
- Animated loading states and transitions
- SEO-optimized meta tags and structured data

### Project Showcase
- Dynamic project cards with detailed information
- Technology tags and highlight features
- Links to live demos and source code
- Categorized project organization
- Rich descriptions with technical details

## üõ†Ô∏è Development Guidelines

### When Adding New Features
1. **Maintain Responsiveness**: Test on mobile, tablet, and desktop
2. **Theme Compatibility**: Ensure features work in both light and dark themes
3. **Performance First**: Optimize images, minimize HTTP requests
4. **Accessibility**: Include proper ARIA labels, semantic markup
5. **SEO Considerations**: Update meta tags and structured data as needed

### API Integration Best Practices
- Use GitHub API rate limiting awareness
- Implement caching strategies for frequently accessed data
- Provide fallback content when API calls fail
- Use loading indicators for better UX
- Handle network errors gracefully

### Content Management
- Update `projects-data.json` for new projects with complete metadata
- Include relevant technologies, highlights, and descriptions
- Maintain consistent project categorization
- Add appropriate GitHub repository links

## üéØ Specific Areas of Focus

### Performance Optimization
- Lazy load images and non-critical resources
- Minimize and compress CSS/JS assets
- Use efficient DOM manipulation techniques
- Implement intersection observer for animations

### SEO & Discoverability
- Update structured data for schema.org compliance
- Maintain comprehensive meta tag coverage
- Include proper Open Graph and Twitter Card tags
- Update sitemap.xml when adding new pages

### Mobile Experience
- Prioritize touch-friendly interaction areas
- Ensure readable typography on small screens
- Optimize navigation for mobile usage patterns
- Test across different device orientations

## üîß Technology Stack Details

### Core Technologies
- **HTML5**: Semantic markup with proper document structure
- **CSS3**: Custom properties, Flexbox, Grid, animations
- **JavaScript**: ES6+, Fetch API, DOM manipulation
- **GitHub API**: Repository data, user statistics
- **GitHub Actions**: Automated metrics generation

### Third-Party Services
- GitHub Pages hosting
- GitHub API for dynamic content
- Font resources (if applicable)
- Any analytics services

## üìù Content Guidelines

### Writing Style
- Professional yet approachable tone
- Technical accuracy with accessible explanations
- Highlight key achievements and innovations
- Use active voice and concise descriptions

### Project Descriptions
- Include clear technology stacks
- Highlight unique features and innovations
- Provide context for business/technical value
- Link to live demos when available

## üö® Important Considerations

### Rate Limiting
- GitHub API has rate limits; implement appropriate caching
- Use authenticated requests when possible for higher limits
- Provide graceful degradation when limits are reached

### Browser Compatibility
- Support modern browsers (Chrome 70+, Firefox 65+, Safari 12+, Edge 79+)
- Provide fallbacks for CSS Grid and Flexbox if needed
- Test JavaScript features across target browsers

### Security
- Use HTTPS for all external resources
- Implement Content Security Policy headers where possible
- Sanitize any user-generated content (if applicable)

## üéØ Common Tasks & Workflows

### Adding a New Project
1. Update `projects-data.json` with complete project information
2. Ensure proper categorization and technology tags
3. Test the display in the projects section
4. Verify responsive layout with new content
5. Update any relevant meta descriptions if needed

### Updating GitHub Integration
1. Test API endpoint changes
2. Verify error handling for failed requests
3. Update any hardcoded repository references
4. Check rate limiting implications
5. Test loading states and fallbacks

### Theme/Design Updates
1. Update CSS custom properties for consistency
2. Test changes in both light and dark modes
3. Verify mobile responsiveness
4. Check contrast ratios for accessibility
5. Update any theme-specific assets

Remember: This portfolio represents Matthew Anderson's professional brand and technical expertise. Maintain high standards for code quality, performance, and user experience.
